description: Xenops are small woodcreeper-like birds found in Neotropical forests, adapted to foraging on bark and branches.
They feed on insects and arthropods found on tree surfaces.
Xerus are African ground squirrels that inhabit savannas and open habitats, living in burrows and foraging on seeds and plants.
They are social and live in colonies.
Xenopus (African clawed frog) are aquatic frogs used in research and found in freshwater habitats across Africa.
They feed on small aquatic invertebrates and are capable swimmers.
The Xoloitzcuintli (Xolo) is a Mexican hairless dog breed with ancient cultural significance and variable sizes.
They are companion animals today, historically also used for ritual purposes.
Xantus's murrelet is a small seabird named after the naturalist Xantus, found in the eastern Pacific and nesting on islands.
They feed on small fish and forage at sea.
